projects.title: Digital Farmer Field School
projects.description:
https://www.wageningenur.nl/nl/project/A-digital-farmer-field-school-.htm

Due to the Ebola outbreak in Sierra Leone, gatherings with more than 5 farmers at a time were not allowed which interrupted a certification training process for 30.000 smallholder cocoa farmers. 
This urgent situation was the direct motivation for FairMatch Support to imagine an innovative design  of innovative learning strategies for cocoa certification training in Sierra Leone which resulted in  the science shop project Digital Farmer Field School

https://www.wageningenur.nl/nl/project/A-digital-farmer-field-school-.htm

projects.title: Upcoming: VPA Wadden Sea
projects.description:
Op 28 augustus in Wilhelsmhaven, Duitsland heb ik met Paddy Walker (lector Duurzame Visserij en Aquacultuur, Kust en Zeemanagement VHL Leeuwarden) en Judith Santegoets (Bos en Natuurbeheer, VHL Velp) de internationale Wadden Sea Day 2014 bijgewoond.
De ‘Wadden Sea Day’ stond dit jaar in het teken van de recente toekenning van World Heritage status aan het volledige Waddenzee gebied en de 35 jarige samenwerking van Nederlandse, Duitse en Deense organisaties om dit doel te bereiken en ter gelegenheid van de afscheid van de secretaris Jens Enemark, die zich al 27jaar had ingezet voor de trilaterale samenwerking. De VHL deelname vond plaats in de context van plannen om een onderwijs leeromgeving te ontwikkelen die  focust op de complexe problematiek van biodiversiteit, klimaatsverandering, toerisme en andere economische activiteiten in het fragiel ecosysteem van de Wadden Sea. Er was ook kans om de mogelijkheden voor internationale samenwerking op het gebied van beheer en onderzoek in de Waddenzee te bespreken.

www.waddensea-secretariat.org.

projects.title: Center of Excellence Fayoum Farmer Fieldschools
projects.description:
The publication 'Learning for transformation. FFS in Minds' illustrates the work of the Centre of Excellence Fayoum Farmer Field Schools, Egypt. It provides input to the training of FFS facilitators with the ambition that sharing and reflection on the experiences in the Fayoum FFS creates opportunities for learning and inspiration.

projects.title: Exploring privatised Soil Testing Services in East African
projects.description:
With students from the master specialisation Rural Development and Innovation we are collaborating with the Wageningen based International company Soilcares in the module Rural Communication and Innovation.
Students from Tanzania, Ethiopia and Ghana are undertaking thesis research related to knowledge brokering, innovation intermediaries and privates agricultural extension.

www.soilcares.com

projects.title: Water Sanitation and Community Art Filming in Nicaragua
projects.description:
Fuente de Amor. Film made in 1993 as a conclusion of a five-year drinking water project of The Hague and Juigalpa (Nicaragua), commissioned by the Twinning of The Hague - Juigalpa. Scenario inspired by contributions (text and drawings) of the population of Juigalpa. Acted by local amateurs. Written and directed by Loes Witteveen and produced by Dialoog Produkties.

Fuente de Amor. Película realizada en 1993 como conclusión de un proyecto de agua potable de cinco años de La Haya y Juigalpa (Nicaragua), encargado por el Hermanamiento de La Haya - Juigalpa. Escenario inspirado por contribuciones (texto y dibujos) de la población. Interpretado por aficionados locales. Escrita y dirigida por Loes Witteveen y producido por Dialoog Produkties.

Fuente de Amor. Speelfilm uit 1993 gemaakt als afsluiting van een 5 jaar durend drinkwaterproject van Den Haag en Juigalpa (Nicaragua) in opdracht van de stedenband Den Haag - Juigalpa. Scenario geïnspireerd op bijdragen (teksten en tekeningen) van de bevolking. Gespeeld door lokale amateurs. Geschreven en geregisseerd door Loes Witteveen en geproduceerd door Dialoog Produkties.

company.name: Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
Contemporary transitions responding to climate change, biodiversity loss and resource scarcity  require shared visions on a sustainable future.

The research group Communication, Participation & Social-Ecological learning (CoPSEL) aims to contribute to transition processes for sustainable futures by exploring processes of communication, participation and social-ecological learning in regional, national and international contexts. The recent advice on the role of the central government in the transition to a sustainable economy of the Council for Environment and Infrastructure refers to this in the recommendation formulated as “Transitions require a coherent future vision on a sustainable society despite the uncertainty on how this future will develop”.

This recommendation emphasises the relevance of a multi-stakeholder and system approach while working on assigned responsibilities in which short term interests and prevailing paradigms conflict with long term ambitions, ‘social-imaginaries’ and desirable governance practices.

The group works in arenas of knowledge co-creation, participatory and deliberative governance focusing on projects and partnerships that takes place in configurations such as living labs where the private sector, civil society, knowledge institutions and the government collaborate. Applying a perspective of experience capitalisation highlights the interest of the group to document and share outcomes of value creation in citizen, professional and academic spaces. The research group has a specific expertise in the field of visual learning strategies, serious gaming and developing Living Labs.
profile_positions.title: Research group Communication, Participation & Social-Ecological Learning

profile_positions.company: Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
In cooperation with the professorship Sustainable River Management, Kerala University of Fisheries and Ocean Studies (KUFOS). India and TU Delft we are working on a new series of VPA films in the context of the heavy rainfall in the Monsoon season and the floods of 2018 and 2019. 

VPA Kerala’s Coast 2.0 will serve as a contemporary tool to support Integrated Water Management Initiatives and for higher education in Kerala, The Netherlands and other delta areas.
This updated VPA Kerala’s Coast with interviews from 2003 to 2020 allows a long-term research perspective on climate change, climate adaptation, community resilience and an adaptive governance

KUFOS organised in November 2019 a preconference activity on VPA at the AQUBE conference 2019
profile_positions.title: VPA Kerala's Coast 2.0

profile_positions.description:
After designing and prototyping Digital Farmer Field School in Eastern Sierra Leone During the Ebola epidemic and the Digital Herder Service Centre project in Mongolia, we are now training staff of the Ministry of Agriculture, Ministry of Environment, the Ministry of Livestock and the regional government for the design and development of Digital Farmer Field School / Sekolah Lapang Digital Enrekang, in Enrekang South Sulawesi.
The project is in close cooperation with the Research Centre of Communication, Social Ecological Learning and Sustainable Environment of the university of Enrekang UNIMEN.
profile_positions.title: Digital Farmer Field School - Sekolah Lapang Digital

company.name: Environmental policy group. Wageniningen University & research

profile_positions.company: Environmental policy group. Wageniningen University & research
profile_positions.description:
The Whalers’ House. Stories of cultural heritage on Texel is an ethnographic documentary produced in the Pericles project ‘Cultural heritage of European coastal and maritime regions CULT-COOP-07 2017’, which is a research and innovation action (RIA) call from the EU’s Horizon 2020 programme.

English version: The Whalers’ House. Stories of cultural heritage on Texel
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A_j8JeF1cBE
Dutch version: t Walvisvaarders Huisje. Verhalen van cultureel erfgoed op Texel
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EtpkCzNbkmo
French version: La maison du baleinier. L'histoire du patrimoine culturel de Texel
https://youtu.be/Cr-PYofEwRA
Duitse versie: Das Walfängerhaus. Geschichten des Kulturerbes auf Texel
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NCmubU5fm6g

The documentary The Whalers’ House. Stories of cultural heritage on Texel is made by Loes Witteveen & Pauline van Tuyll.

In cooperation with Annetje Capitain – Bendien and Ineke Vonk of ‘t Walvisvaardershuisje. Texel.  http://www.walvisvaardershuisjetexel.nl
And with Alec Ewing. Conservator Museum Kaap Skil. Texel. https://www.kaapskil.nl/en/

Production: 		Environmental Policy Group, Wageningen University & Research
Music:  			Andro Ackerman
Audio post production: 	Erwin Palper
Subtitling: 		inVision ondertiteling
Length: 			23’
Recording: 		May and November 2019
Language: 	The documentary is Dutch spoken with versions subtitled in English, French and German

The Pericles project has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under grant agreement No 770504 www.pericles-heritage.eu
profile_positions.title: Ethnographic documentary: The Whalers' House. Stories of cultural heritage on Texel

company.name: Van Hall Larenstein of Applied Sciences, Rijkswaterstaat

profile_positions.company: Van Hall Larenstein of Applied Sciences, Rijkswaterstaat
profile_positions.description:
The Visual Problem Appraisal ‘Rhine river branches’ searches to develop strategic guidance for the complex, multi-stakeholder setting of sustainable river management for the river Rhine and its branches in the Netherlands. The VPA aims to create a tool to support innovative governance as it shapes processes of participation and social learning, creating social imaginaries of sustainable resource management and policy platforms to communicate about sustainable river futures.
The consortium of RSW, VHL and HAN will continue developing the VPA Rhine River branches in 2018 – 2022, and further explore its use in higher education and for deliberative and participatory governance.
profile_positions.title: Visual Problem Appraisal - VPA Rijntakken

company.name: Van Hall Larenstein Unviersity of Applied Sciences, Institute of Technology Bandung

profile_positions.company: Van Hall Larenstein Unviersity of Applied Sciences, Institute of Technology Bandung
profile_positions.description:
The research project ‘Creative strategies and public participation as convincing strategies in the (re)configuration of Living Labs; Exploring 21st century skills in complex multi stakeholder situations’ is a research project of the Living Lab Upper Citarum, Java, Indonesia.
The project is implemented by the Institute of Technology (ITB), Faculty of Civil and Environmental Engineering, Environmental Management and Technology Research Group, Bandung, Indonesia, by Telkom University, the research group Environmental and Development Communication, Bandung, Indonesia and by Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences, the research group Communication, Participation & Social Ecological Learning, Delta Areas and Resources (ARC DARe), The Netherlands.
The project has been funded by the Dutch taskforce for Applied Research, Nationaal Regieorgaan Praktijkgericht Onderzoek, and the involved universities and institutions.
In November 2018 fieldwork was undertaken in Kampong Ciwalengke and Sukahaji in Majalaya, and Kampong Cipaku, Banjaran has been organised in cooperation with EPA West Java Province, EPA Bandung District, and Environmental NGO Elingan.
profile_positions.title: Suara Citarum | Citarum Voices

profile_positions.title: VPA Climate Change Adaptation Knowledges of Indigenous communities in Aurora Province, Philippines

profile_positions.description:
river flows - an artistic approach towards community resilience, participation and social learning in natural resource management

River flows is a project of Natuurmonumenten in cooperation with the research group Sustainable River Management of Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences. The project explores an artistic approach towards community resilience, participation and social learning in natural resource management. A short film shows the making of the poetry route Koppenwaard by students of the MSc Management of Development with the support of Natuurmonumenten, Hoge Veluwe National Park, NUFFIC, Hogeschool Arnhem-Nijmegen. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TKBOKTNZhcs

A press release in Dutch can be found at http://www.arnhemsekoerier.nl/nieuws/algemeen/183927/kunst-en-gedichten-bevorderen-participatie-in-de-koppenwaard
profile_positions.title: river flows

company.name: Applied research: sustainable river managment VHL - HAN

profile_positions.company: Applied research: sustainable river managment VHL - HAN
profile_positions.description:
'A fieldtrip to Ciwalengke' documents an exploratory activity of the Living Lab Upper Citarum River Basin, filmed and edited on 19 & 20 November 2016 by Loes, Witteveen, Niko Junianto, Deni Ruswandi, Agus Gutaman, Amah Fauroji, Tjallie Botden, Alit and Iwa. The fieldtrip has been organised by the Institute of Technology Bandung, Indonesia and Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences, The Netherlands.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3FlpZqPPr68&t=10s

Beyond the Snow - MoD explores Stadsblokken Meinerswijk is a short trailer of a site visit undertaken by international students Management of Development (MSc) of Van Hall Larenstein University on Tuesday 17 January 2017.
The student’s research the future interests of inhabitants of Arnhem for leisure and cultural activities in the area Stadsblokken Meinerswijk. This research is a collaboration between the Municipality of Arnhem and Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences and aims to contribute to a further development of the riverbank park Stadsblokken Meinerswijk. The research is organised and implemented by Jeroen Rijke, Loes Witteveen, Suzanne van der Meulen from the Research group Sustainable River Management of Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PhHZRZIkFpk&t=5s
profile_positions.title: Community resilience, participation & social learning
